title: SSL/TLS support for StreamSocketListener
body: It's impossible with a Universal App to accept SSL connections for TCP streams.    This makes authenticating remote connections impossible.   I'm running an extremely basic web server from my app to allow people to remotely control the app over wifi from a browser.   This is possible through the StreamSocketListener but I can't encrypt it.

comments.body:
StreamSocket and StreamSocketListener (cause you know you need to add TLS support to StreamSocketListener!) require a way to customise the certificate validation (such as validating Issuer Name rather than Server Name) as the current implementation is extremely limiting when using self-signed/atypical-CA certificates.
Use case: connecting to secure IoT devices with certificates that have unique Server Names that are not reachable via DNS, but have consistent Issuer Names.
its been 2 yrs now, any news on this one? Trying to implement SSL/TLS server that can run as background task. Seem impossible?
